title: SAP Consultant - IS Retail Pricing (m/f/d) (relocation possible)
Personal Shopping and Client Relations Manager (f/m/d)
Head of HR Business Partners Europe (m/f/d)
Working Student/Intern Machine Learning (m/f/d)
desc:
The building sector is responsible for 40 percent of CO2 emissions in Germany, making it the largest contributor. Moreover, we spend most of our time indoors, which gives us all the more reason to operate buildings in a way that keeps people at the center, both now and in the long term. As a young PropTech startup, we are committed to exactly this goal: to operate buildings in an automated, reliable, and sustainable manner. With our intelligent building control system, we are on the path to achieving a climate-neutral building stock by 2045.
As a Working Student/Intern Machine Learning (m/f/d), you will work closely with top experts in their field, gaining invaluable hands-on experience with innovative technology developed over five years of research. You'll have the opportunity to deepen your machine learning skills by contributing to cutting-edge projects in energy optimization and predictive analytics.
Aufgaben
What You’ll Work On: 

Design and deploy ML models for energy optimization and predictive analytics, integrating solutions that are both robust and efficient. 
Develop, test, and implement cost-effective, real-time energy management strategies. 
Optimized Workflows with CI/CD and MLOps by streamlining data handling, feature engineering, and model management to improve efficiency. 
Build predictive models for real-time device health monitoring, boosting uptime and reducing maintenance costs.

Qualifikation
Who We’re Looking For: 

You’re in your 5th semester or higher in a Bachelor’s or Master’s program in Informatics or a related field. 
Proficiency in Python and ML frameworks (TensorFlow, PyTorch) is essential.
Familiarity with scalable architectures and DevOps tools (like Docker, Kubernetes, or Kubeflow) is a plus. 
You’re proactive, highly organized, and driven to push boundaries to set new standards in ML.

Benefits
Why baind AG: 

Your Impact: Join us in transforming the building sector, responsible for 40% of Germany’s CO₂ emissions and drive toward a climate-neutral future by 2045. 
Your Chance: Join as one of the first team members in our ML team, taking on opportunities to grow with a high-impact startup that just closed a successful seed round and is ready to take off with you. 
Competitive Pay: Starting at 21 €/h, with the potential for a raise after six months based on performance. 
Comprehensive Resources: Access our in-house compute cluster for model training and fine-tuning. 
Flexible Work Environment: Choose between macOS or Linux, work up to 50% remotely, and benefit from flexible hours. 
Work-Life Balance: Enjoy a Wellpass membership with access to over 10,000 sports and wellness facilities across Germany.

Apply with your resume, transcript, and a brief note on why you’re a perfect fit. Specify if you’re applying for an internship, working student role, or thesis project. We are looking forward to your application!

title: Senior IT recruiter (m/f/d)
desc:
Are you a skilled tech recruiter with a passion for technology? Do you have a proven track record of identifying and attracting top talent? We are seeking a Senior IT recruiter (m/f/d) to join our team and help us continue to grow and thrive. This is a full-time, full-remote position.
About us
Transparent Hiring is an IT recruiting and relocation company specializing in hiring English-speaking IT talents for German companies and relocating them to Germany. We work with large established German enterprises as well as young and dynamic start-ups, hiring for a wide variety of tech roles, including web, mobile, QA, data, and many more.
We are located in Bavaria, Germany, but operate 100% remotely and accept candidates from anywhere, given that your working hours sufficiently overlap with ours.
About the role
In this role, you will be responsible for identifying, attracting, and hiring top technology professionals for a variety of roles. This will involve understanding the specific staffing needs of our clients, finding qualified candidates, and supporting them along the application process.
We look for someone who is as passionate as us about helping people find jobs and start a new life in a new country. If you want to shape the future of the small, but growing company, proactively contribute to the way we work, and grow together – you’ve found the right place.
Tasks

Screen and interview candidates to assess their skills, experience, and fit for the role
Source candidates for positions that can’t be closed with incoming job applications alone
Provide guidance and support to candidates throughout the hiring process
Coordinate job offers and negotiations with candidates
Maintain accurate records and tracking metrics to measure the effectiveness of recruiting efforts
Optimize recruiting processes and tools to improve efficiency
Use social networks like Linkedin or Xing to promote the company and open roles

Requirements

Strong communication and interpersonal skills, ability to establish trust and rapport with people
Experience as an IT recruiter (preferably in a staffing agency)
Experience in hiring on the global market (preferably German)
Good understanding of the information technology industry
Self-organization and time management skills
Fluent English C1+

Benefits

Informal, friendly and collaborative atmosphere in the team
Work from anywhere in the world
Flexible working hours
Performance bonuses for successful hires

Want the flexibility of working from anywhere? Want to work with people that love and enjoy what they do? Join our young international team and become part of a friendly and collaborative environment, with zero bureaucracy, and quick decision-making. You will work directly with the founding team and get an opportunity to shape the company in its early days.
If you are a skilled tech recruiter with a passion for technology, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and help us continue to grow and thrive.

title: Junior Communications Manager EU Projects - Aqua Team (m/f/d)
desc:
sPro - sustainable-projects is a consultancy specialized in the coordination of transnational projects, mostly funded by the European Commission. Our topical focus lies in projects dealing with the sustainable use of the sea. We run the permanent secretariat of the SUBMARINER Network for Blue Growth and act as coordinators of the EU Mission Ocean in the Baltic and North Sea. SUBMARINER is the cooperation platform for actors/initiatives across the Baltic Sea Region and beyond who promote innovative and sustainable uses of marine resources.
We have a long-term portfolio of over 25 large-scale projects and operate with an extensive network of trusted cooperation partners from all European countries, encompassing research, industry, business development, NGOs, and the public sector. We currently have 35 employees coming from a wide range of different academic backgrounds with more than 15 different nationalities.
The Aquatic Value Chains team manages SUBMARINER Network and s Pro’s participation in 12 different projects and service contracts focusing on topics including algae and mussel cultivation and product development, sustainable fisheries, recirculating aquaculture systems and ocean regeneration.
Tasks

Planning and implementing communications and dissemination strategies and activities in the framework of EU-funded projects across different topics (e.g. algae and mussel cultivation and product development, sustainable fisheries, recirculating aquaculture systems and ocean regeneration).
Planning, organising and participating in meetings and events (in-person & online), overseeing logistics and technical support when necessary.
Converting reports and other project content into understandable articles, abstracts, presentations, animations, etc., for our various media channels.
Content design and optimisation of the appearance and content of our various websites (text, images, graphics, podcasts, video), social media accounts (LinkedIn, Facebook, Instagram, Twitter, YouTube, TikTok), and other communications content.
Ensuring that project communication is coherent and feeds into the company-level communication strategy.
Assisting in various tasks within the management of projects.

Requirements

Relevant university degree.
First relevant work experience, ideally working in EU projects and/or relevant industry sectors.
Excellent English with proven writing skills. Additional languages (especially advanced German) are a plus.
Proven ability in project communications, management and verbal communication.
Digital native with good knowledge of the Microsoft Suite (Word, Excel, Powerpoint), CMS (esp. WordPress), collaboration tools (e.g., Miro, slido) and able to create attractive digital content (e.g. Canva, InDesign, Adobe Photoshop, Illustrator).
Experience on how to use social media as a dissemination tool (e.g., LinkedIn, Twitter, YouTube, TikTok).
Understanding of European political processes; esp. in the field of climate and environmental protection is a plus.

Benefits

A meaningful job in a very dynamically evolving environment, where you contribute to restoring our Seas and Oceans and promoting a sustainable blue economy.
An interesting multi-cultural, international and diverse team.
Opportunity to travel within Europe for project meetings and events.
Individual career development.
A beautiful loft office in Berlin.
Up to three home office days per week; flexible working hours and 28 days of holiday annually.
Regular overall team retreats to promote internal knowledge transfer, generate shared ideas and strengthen the working atmosphere.
Annual salary range of EUR 33.000 to 42.000 depending on experience.

title: Technical co-founder
desc:
Imagine empowering children and families to thrive. 
Now, imagine yourself at the heart of this transformation.
Join us as a technical co-founder to drive real impact! 
🌍 Our Vision & 🎯 Mission:
MUMBI is an AI-powered app focused on enhancing the brain and mental health of children and parents. Our vision is to empower families to become smarter and more resilient through science-backed play. Our mission is to make brain-boosting, personalized play a seamless part of daily life using everyday items. With almost 90% of a child’s brain developing by age five and mental health challenges predicted to affect half the world (WHO), early intervention is essential to prevent mental health struggles and help families thrive.

👉 Has proven ability to scale products and lead engineering teams
👉 Is ideally a parent and previous founder, or an entrepreneurial mind

title: Operations Manager (m/f/d)
desc:
Founded in 2021, the company is a trailblazing supply chain platform that has redefined the way large construction material orders are sourced, distributed, and financed. They are on a mission to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing access to high-quality construction materials at a global scale through their innovative platform. Since its launch in January 2022, the company has successfully served hundreds of companies and generated exponential growth toward profitability.  
The company’s distinct competitive advantage lies in its ability to organize the supply chain through digital innovation. By eliminating middlemen and embracing tech-first and AI, it creates a seamless connection between suppliers and buyers. Its proprietary platform technology not only facilitates supply and demand matching but also offers a comprehensive suite of services, including cloud inventory management, fulfillment solutions, and fintech capabilities.  
Since its inception, the company has been at the forefront of construction material management, helping companies access high-quality materials efficiently and cost-effectively. The platform provides a user-friendly experience that empowers businesses to thrive. The company counts 75+ FTEs located across Germany (Berlin HQ), China, and India. The company is on track to achieve profitability and generated triple digits million GMV.
Tasks

Be the referent for all post-sales customer-related topics.
Ensure timely and satisfactory resolution of all incoming customer inquiries while staying aligned with business objectives.
Develop and implement scalable processes.
Identify opportunities to improve the customer experience, increase retention, and generate additional post-sales revenue streams
Work with departments such as Logistics and Product to ensure seamless coordination and alignment on customer-related initiatives.

Requirements

You possess a Bachelor's degree or Master's degree in Business or a related field
You are curious and passionate about hyper growth startups 
You want to change a traditional industry together with an international team
You have strong analytical and communication skills - you have ability to clearly articulate complex subject materials
You possess Hands-on mentality - only the implementation satisfies you
You bring first experience in a highly competitive and fast paced environment such as Management Consulting, Investment Banking, Venture Capital or a high-growth startup
You have excellent communication skills in German and English

Benefits

A role to fulfill with entrepreneurial freedom and a pre-validated business model to be pushed to the next level
An experienced founding team (three companies, 2 exits)
A future-proof job with an attractive salary in a successful and value-oriented company
Collaboration with top-tier investors and angles (incl. various unicorn founders) as well as leading market experts
A challenging yet rewarding work environment, and the opportunity to make a significant impact within a rapidly growing company
Beautiful office space in the center of Berlin, monthly all-hands, team events, and team lunches

Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe in an industry that is starving for innovative solutions. Work with an international intercultural team led by serial entrepreneurs and seasoned executives, advised by some of the brightest minds in the industry.
We are looking forward to hearing from you!

title: Software Quality Assurance and Certification Engineer (w/m/d) - 100%
desc:
CONCAPE is a specialized recruiter and supports an international, specialized company in the field of high technology and mechanical engineering with this vacancy.
Work location: Lake Constance region, Germany
Workload: 100%
Home office: 2 days
The company has enabled its development into a renowned company in areas such as construction machinery, transportation technology and engineering thanks to product innovation & employees (m/f).
Aufgaben
Software Quality Assurance and Certification Engineer (w/m/d) - 100%
Your challenges

Ensure quality and delivery capability: As a Supplier Quality Engineer, you ensure that suppliers' products and services meet the company's quality standards and delivery deadlines.
Define and communicate quality requirements: As a Supplier Quality Engineer, you define the quality requirements for products and services and communicate these to suppliers.
Coordinate and monitor approval procedures: As a Supplier Quality Manager, you will coordinate and monitor supplier approval procedures to ensure they meet the company's requirements.
Participate in projects: As a Supplier Quality Engineer, you will often work on projects to improve collaboration with suppliers and ensure the quality of products and services.
Optimize work processes: As a Supplier Quality Manager, you can help optimize workflows to reduce costs and improve efficiency.
Perform failure analysis: As a Supplier Quality Engineer, you will perform failure analyses to determine the root causes of failures and resolve them.

Qualifikation
Your qualifications

Degree in industrial engineering, mechanical engineering, aerospace engineering or a related field
Experience with audits and an additional qualification as an auditor are an advantage
Comprehensive knowledge of the Advanced Product Quality Planning (APQP) process, including its components
Fluency in German and English
Analytical thinking and a solution-oriented way of working
Willingness to travel extensively
Self-motivation and the ability to assert yourself

Benefits

We look forward to getting in touch with you.

title: Performance Marketing Manager (m/f/d) - Remote
desc:
Performance Marketing is a crucial part of our go-to-market strategy at Xentral ERP Software. We are looking for an experienced performance marketing expert, who helps us to generate MQL optimised for cost per SQL.   
You will be responsible for our performance marketing strategy in alignment with our overarching business plan and all our paid channels - currently Google Ads, Microsoft Ads, LinkedIn Ads and META Ads. In alignment with the demand generation team (Paid, SEO, Content & CVRO) you are a driving force for demand generation and lead capture tactics.
Your Tasks:

Manage the entire lifecycle of performance marketing campaigns with a strong focus on Google Ads Hands-on implement and extend demand generation strategies within Google Ads, LinkedIn Ads, META Ads
Help to identify and set up new paid marketing channels (e.g. review pages such as Capterra & OMR Reviews, Content Syndication, …)
Define – and with the help of our designer and CVRO specialist – support A/B testing of landing page, ad copy, creatives
Crunch data on a daily basis to monitor and improve the performance of all channels based on cost per SQL (use Hubspot oriented channel reporting)
Manage budget and media planning while analysing and presenting performance insights confidently
Support landing page creation and optimization, contributing to demand generation through LinkedIn, YouTube, and Google Demand Gen
Develop and implement re-targeting tactics across multiple channels, focusing on high-performing video and image creatives.

Your Profile:

You have 2 years hands-on experience in growing performance marketing, ideally for a B2B SaaS company
You have strong hands-on expertise in managing Google Ads
Ideally you have first experience working with paid social channels
You are used to work in a dynamic environment – experience in a scale-up would be a big plus
You are analytically driven and understand technical aspects of performance marketing like e.g. conversion tracking, attribution, etc
You have a hands-on mentality
Our target audience is focused mainly in german-speaking countries, so you are fluent or near-native in German, as you have to write ads or support with landing page content

We offer 
Flexible Work Environment: Enjoy remote work options across Europe or from our office-hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam, Berlin, Munich, and Lohne (Oldenburg), along with flexible working hours.  
Competitive Compensation & Comprehensive Benefits: Attractive salary packages and a generous leave policy that includes 28 annual leave days, special leave days, and nursing care days. Our comprehensive benefits package also provides a monthly voucher to choose from a variety of providers, including Urban Sports Club, grocery stores, entertainment, and lifestyle options. Additionally, we equip all employees with state-of-the-art home office equipment and offer a 50% subsidy on private pension plans for permanent employees in Germany.  
Professional Growth & Development: Benefit from a significant budget dedicated to learning and personal development, supporting your career growth and continuous learning.  
Inclusive & Engaging Culture: Participate in virtual and in-person company events and in our yearly culture connect days, fostering a collaborative and vibrant company culture with minimal hierarchies and respectful communication.  
Diverse & International Team: Work alongside a multicultural and international team across 17 different work locations within Europe and 32 nationalities, embracing diversity and a global perspective.  
You have what it takes? Then apply now with your CV or LinkedIn profile. 
We look forward to your application! 
About us 
We are an established tech startup with major tech investors Sequoia Capital and Visionaries Club on our side. We are aiming at defining a new SaaS category and empower entrepreneurs and e-commerce vendors to automate their resource planning and focus on the things that matters most to them: their business.
We grow all over Europe, join us fully remote or in one of our hubs in Augsburg, Amsterdam, Berlin, Munich and Lohne (Oldenburg). You decide!

title: Site Reliability Engineer
desc:
Full-time (40 h), as soon as possible, permanent and based in Berlin or remotely in home office. 
We’re seeking an experienced Site Reliability Engineer (SRE) with a solid foundation in Python, a passion for performance optimization, and a proactive approach to infrastructure management. In this role, you’ll work closely with development and operations teams to maintain, monitor, and improve the reliability of our systems, leveraging cutting-edge tools and methodologies to ensure peak performance.
Tasks

Design, implement, and optimize systems to improve the reliability, performance, and scalability of our services.
Build and maintain observability solutions using tools like Jaeger, Prometheus, and Grafana to enhance monitoring, tracing, and alerting across applications.
Collaborate with development teams to build, manage, and scale Kubernetes environments, ensuring high availability and robust service delivery.
Develop automation scripts and tools in Python to enhance system reliability and reduce manual intervention.
Diagnose and resolve incidents, conduct root-cause analysis, and implement measures to prevent recurrence.
Participate in on-call rotations, ensuring rapid response to system issues while continuously improving incident management processes.

Requirements

Proficiency in Python for scripting and automation.
Experience with tracing tools such as Jaeger or similar to troubleshoot and monitor complex distributed systems.
Experience with monitoring tools such as Prometheus or similar for collecting and alerting on metrics.
Experience with dashboarding tools such as Grafana or similar for creating visualizations that aid in system monitoring and diagnostics.
Experience working in Kubernetes environments, with an understanding of container orchestration, scaling, and resource management.

Preferred Qualifications (Optional):

Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and DevOps practices.
Familiarity with cloud platforms (AWS, GCP, Azure) and infrastructure-as-code tools like OpenTofu.

Benefits

Competitive salary
Flexible work hours and remote work opportunities.
A beautiful Gather remote office
An ambitious and helpful team
Opportunity to work with cutting-edge technologies and make a significant impact in a fast-growing startup environment

Are you interested?
Then apply right now by sending your CV If available, please include a Github link. A cover letter is not necessary.
If you have any questions, please contact us or just give us a call!

title: AI Software Developer in Test (f/m/d)
desc:
Position Description
As an AI Software Development Engineer in Test (f/m/d), under the leadership of the Test Manager you will be responsible for developing test cases and automated test scripts to maintain the high quality of Cinemo’s solutions and ensure compliance with regulatory, corporate and customer standards/requirements. In this role, you will work in a cross-functional engineering team to understand and implement the scope of the work, use your passion to help maintain our high-quality software and machine learning components with the use of manual and automated testing techniques. This role requires an energetic and motivated individual with strong communication, organization, and technical skills who works well in a fast-paced dynamic environment
In this role, you will:

Design, develop, and execute test cases, test plans for Machine Learning, Android, iOS, and web applications
Produce requirements traceability matrices, automation feasibility analysis, time estimations
Contribute to the definition and refinement of the test strategy and be an advocate for quality practices in your team
Identify and document ML model accuracies, software defects, track issues and collaborate with the machine learning and development team to resolve them
Utilize testing frameworks and tools to automate test cases and enhance test coverage
Suggest procedure improvements and contribute to improving internal tooling and processes

What you will need to succeed:

Minimum of 5 years of AI/ML test automation and machine learning frameworks experience (e.g., Appium, Selenium, TensorFlow, PyTorch, Keras)
Very good experience in Machine Learning, including knowledge in the areas of Natural Language Processing and Computer Vision
Expert-level knowledge in the programming languages (Python, Java, C++)
Strong experience with Linux operating systems and proficiency with CLI tools and scripting.
Experience with CI/CD tools (e.g., Jenkins) and MLOps tools (e.g. W&B, MLFlow, Airflow)
Very good written and verbal English communication skills

title: Technology Business Management (TBM) Consultant (m/w/d)
desc:
Are you ready to make a tangible impact on the future of IT efficiency? At Liquid Reply, we’re looking for passionate TBM Consultants who want to empower enterprise leaders to manage IT spending effectively and leverage IT resources to their fullest potential. As a trusted advisor, you'll bridge the gap between Business, Finance, and IT, driving strategic change from within for the whole of IT.
Technology Business Management (TBM) is a discipline that helps organizations to optimize their IT spending, align technology investments with business goals and ensures greater financial transparency. Our expertise makes us their Trusted Advisor to align the interests of Business, Finance and IT to drive the change from within.
Tasks

Client Project Delivery


Plan, manage and deliver TBM consulting engagements, working closely with client stakeholders to deliver solutions that drive financial transparency, cost optimization, and business alignment.
Assess clients’ current technology and financial environments, recommending and implementing customized TBM frameworks and solutions.
Leverage TBM tools to provide insights into IT costs, value, and business impact, ensuring clients maximize return on their technology investments.


Business Development & Strategy


Identify growth opportunities within existing client accounts and lead efforts to expand TBM services to new clients and sectors.
Develop strategic partnerships and maintain strong client relationships, becoming a trusted advisor for their technology and financial management needs.
Contribute to the development of thought leadership, methodologies, and tools that support the growth of the TBM practice.


Practice Development


Mentor and coach junior consultants and team members, fostering a culture of continuous learning and professional development.
Drive improvements to internal processes, frameworks, and tools, ensuring our consulting offerings remain at the forefront of the TBM industry.

Requirements

Successfully completed university studies in Finance, Business Administration, Accounting, Economics, Information Technology or Information Technology Management
Experience: 2+ years in TBM consulting or related fields, with a strong background in technology cost management, financial management, or IT strategy.
Technical Skills: Proficiency with TBM tools such as Apptio or similar; strong data analysis and financial modeling skills.
Client Management: Proven ability to build and maintain strategic client relationships and lead consulting engagements.
Communication: Excellent interpersonal, communication, and presentation skills, with the ability to convey complex technical and financial concepts clearly to executive stakeholders.
Business Acumen: Strong understanding of IT financial management, budgeting, forecasting, and cost transparency principles.
Very good communication skills in English and German and willingness to travel

Benefits
In addition to an attractive salary, we support your professional development during your daily work as well as through unique training opportunities. As an inventive, diverse, and international team, we share our knowledge continuously and work together. This will help you to develop yourself, build new knowledge and skills, grow your network, and position yourself as an expert.
If you share our passion for personal growth, continuous learning, and a warm and supportive team, become part of Liquid Reply!
If you’re ready to take on the challenges of aligning interests across departments, creating sustainable FinOps practices, and being a catalyst for transformation, we’d love to hear from you. Are you ready?

title: FinOps Consultant (m/w/d)
desc:
Are you ready to make a tangible impact on the future of cloud finance and DevOps?
At Liquid Reply, we’re looking for passionate FinOps Consultants who want to empower enterprise leaders to manage cloud spend effectively and leverage cloud resources to their fullest potential. As a trusted advisor, you'll bridge the gap between Business, Finance, and IT, driving strategic change from within.
FinOps is the combination of DevOps and Finance. Together with our clients, we implement the FinOps Framework; starting with a central FinOps Team that drives the engagement within the client’s organization. Together with other stakeholders, such as DevOps Teams, IT Controlling, or Product Owners, we identify and implement measures to reduce cloud costs and maximize the usage of cloud resources, which maximizes the business value of the cloud, measuring the success of the implementation journey through various metrics.
Tasks

Actively support FinOps projects together with your colleagues to make our customers' cloud usage more efficient and sustainable.
Create transparency through cloud-native or 3rd party tools for cost allocation or optimization potential.
Analyze the client’s cloud environments to highlight optimization potential for all involved cloud services in IaaS, PaaS, or SaaS.
Use your communication skills to interact with various stakeholders from the platform, product, and application teams.
Develop FinOps blueprints and share your knowledge with colleagues.
Prepare and execute FinOps trainings, conference talks, and create blog posts.
Push FinOps topic development within Reply and with the FinOps Foundation.
Work on extending the offering with new opportunities, such as FinOps for sustainability or Technology Business Management.

Requirements

Successfully completed university studies in Data Analytics, Finance, Business Administration, IT Management, or similar.
First experience with data analysis and data visualization tools (e.g., BigQuery, PowerBI, Tableau).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills with a focus on financial data interpretation and insight generation.
Excellent communication and presentation skills to convey complex financial concepts to technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Experience working in agile teams and familiarity with Scrum or Kanban frameworks.
Strong customer orientation, communication skills, and self-initiative.
Cloud certifications (AWS, GCP, Azure) or FinOps Practitioner desirable.
Familiarity with cloud cost management tools (e.g., Cloudability, infracost, kubecost) is a plus.
Intrinsic motivation to drive sustainable and efficient cloud solutions.
Proficiency in English and German with a willingness to travel occasionally.

Benefits
In addition to an attractive salary, we support your professional development during your daily work as well as through unique training opportunities. As an inventive, diverse, and international team, we share our knowledge continuously and work together. This will help you to develop yourself, build new knowledge and skills, grow your network, and position yourself as an expert. If you share our passion for personal growth, continuous learning, and a warm and supportive team, become part of Liquid Reply!

title: Senior Backend Engineer (m/f/d)
desc:

About Company
Founded in 2021, the company is a trailblazing supply chain platform that has redefined the way large construction material orders are sourced, distributed, and financed. They are on a mission to unlock the vast potential of cross-border supply for the Western Market by providing access to high-quality construction materials at a global scale through their innovative platform. Since its launch in January 2022, the company has successfully served hundreds of companies and generated exponential growth toward profitability.
The company’s distinct competitive advantage lies in its ability to organize the supply chain through digital innovation. By eliminating middlemen and embracing tech-first and AI, it creates a seamless connection between suppliers and buyers. Its proprietary platform technology not only facilitates supply and demand matching but also offers a comprehensive suite of services, including cloud inventory management, fulfillment solutions, and fintech capabilities.
Since its inception, the company has been at the forefront of construction material management, helping companies access high-quality materials efficiently and cost-effectively. The platform provides a user-friendly experience that empowers businesses to thrive. The company counts 75+ FTEs located across Germany (Berlin HQ), China, and India. Tech Stack: Java (Spring), Python, node.js, Typescript, NextJS, React, Postgres, Kinesis, Databricks, Terraform, AWS.
Tasks

Design, develop, test, deploy, maintain and own the full cycle software development of the product.
Write clean code to develop functional applications.
Build reusable code and libraries for future use.
Manage individual project priorities and deliverables whilst working in a team that enjoys knowledge-sharing sessions
Collaborate with front-end developers to integrate user-facing elements with server-side logic.
Gather and address technical and design requirements.
Stay up to date with the latest trends in technology.

Requirements

You’re an excellent communicator both around technical and non-technical people.
You have strong knowledge in one of the following modern programming languages: Java, if you are proficient in Python as well, even better!
You have experience in working with relational databases such as PostgreSQL or BigQuery.
You can write clean, maintainable, and reusable code and make design decisions regarding the architecture of the services that you’ll be implementing.
You are familiar with modern CI/CD and developer tooling such as Linters and testing frameworks.
You know what it takes to run distributed systems and have some experience building microservices.
You are proactive in suggesting alternative solutions and pushing your ideas.

Benefits

Small team, flat hierarchy, mission-driven. The usual buzzwords here, except we actually mean them. We’re small, lean, and we love what we’re doing.
A modern tech stack to work with. We use Java mainly but are open to implementing a new framework for our next MVP. Our CI/CD is built with GitHub Actions, and we use AWS for our infrastructure.
You have an impact - you’ll be building a product that people need and are grateful for. Our excellent NPS reviews speak for themselves. We are building our products around people, and they love it!
You’ll have the freedom to experiment. We do hack days/hack weeks where you can experiment with new technologies and new ways of working.

Join one of the fastest-growing B2B companies in Europe, led by an international, intercultural team of serial entrepreneurs, and experienced executives.

title: FinOps Engineer & Consultant (m/w/d)
desc:
Are you ready to make a tangible impact on the future of cloud finance and DevOps?
At Liquid Reply, we’re looking for passionate FinOps Engineers and Consultants who combine technical skills with the FinOps practice to help our clients establish sustainable FinOps governance and automate transparency and optimization activities for a scalable and efficient FinOps practice.
FinOps is the combination of DevOps and Finance. Together with our customers, we implement the FinOps Framework, starting with a central FinOps Team that drives engagement within the client’s organization. Working alongside stakeholders such as DevOps Teams, IT Controlling, and Product Owners, we implement measures to reduce cloud costs and maximize cloud resource usage to enhance the business value of the cloud, measuring success through various metrics.
Tasks

Actively support FinOps projects with your colleagues to make customers' cloud usage more efficient and sustainable.
Develop technical solutions for common FinOps challenges (e.g., tagging, cloud service policies).
Analyze clients' cloud environments to highlight optimization potential for IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS services.
Automate FinOps processes to streamline cloud cost allocation, reporting, and optimization.
Use your communication skills to interact with stakeholders from platform, product, and application teams.
Develop FinOps blueprints and share knowledge with colleagues.
Prepare and execute FinOps trainings, conference talks, and create blog posts.
Push FinOps topic development within Reply and with the FinOps Foundation.
Collaborate with us on new opportunities like FinOps for sustainability or Technology Business Management.

Requirements

Successfully completed university studies in (Business) IT, Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or IT Management.
Experience in agile teams and familiarity with agile project management frameworks (e.g., Scrum, Kanban).
Strong customer orientation, communication skills, self-initiative, and conflict management abilities.
Excellent interpersonal skills, with flexibility to meet client needs and enjoy challenges in a fast-paced environment.
Proficiency with cloud service providers (AWS, Azure, GCP; certifications are a plus).
Curiosity to shape the Cloud FinOps Journey of our customers; a drive to question existing architectures and propose efficiency improvements.
Familiarity with container-based architecture (from a FinOps cost perspective).
Basic knowledge of Infrastructure as Code (IaC) using Terraform.
Intrinsic motivation to drive sustainable and efficient cloud solutions.
Proficiency in English and German, with willingness to travel occasionally.

Benefits
In addition to an attractive salary, we support your professional development through daily work and unique training opportunities. As an inventive, diverse, and international team, we continuously share knowledge and collaborate to help you develop yourself, build new skills, grow your network, and position yourself as an expert. If you share our passion for personal growth, continuous learning, and a warm, supportive team, become part of Liquid Reply!
If you’re ready to take on the challenges of aligning interests across departments, creating sustainable FinOps practices, and being a catalyst for transformation, we’d love to hear from you.
Are you ready?

title: (Junior) DevOps Engineer (f/m/d)
desc:
We are all united by one goal: simple communication. Placetel stands for state-of-the-art and innovative Software-as-a-Service communication solutions from the cloud. More than 35,000 business customers use Placetel daily to make calls and utilize our products to successfully collaborate from anywhere – whether in the office, from home, or on the go. Since our founding in 2008, our company has continuously grown and is now part of Gamma Communications. Together, we are changing the way people work worldwide. Today and in the future.
Aufgaben
To strengthen our engineering team, we are looking for a DevOps Engineer to support and optimize our infrastructure through automation and continuous improvement. Your responsibilities will include:
• Kubernetes with GitOps: Managing Kubernetes clusters with a GitOps approach to streamline deployment processes and ensure consistency across environments.
• CI/CD Pipelines: Building and maintaining robust CI/CD pipelines to enable seamless code integration and delivery.
• On-Premise Data Centers: Maintaining and evolving our on-premise data centers to ensure reliable infrastructure for our communication solutions.
• Cfengine: Utilizing Cfengine to manage configuration automation, ensuring high availability and consistency across our systems.
• Voice Stack: Working with Kamailio and Asterisk for our voice stack, ensuring optimal performance, reliability, and scalability of our communication services.
Note: Not all responsibilities and requirements are mandatory. We value a willingness to learn and grow within the role.
Technologies We Work With
Kubernetes, Docker, FluxCD, Containers, KVM, QEMU, Juniper, Cisco, Apstra, CFEngine, Ansible, Kamailio, Asterisk, Percona Cluster, Google Cloud, AWS, Terraform, Ruby on Rails, Git, Tailscale, Debian, k3s, and many more.
Qualifikation
• Experience: At least 2-3 years of professional experience in DevOps, infrastructure engineering, or a similar position, ideally with professional experience in SaaS or the tech industry.
• Education: A degree in computer science, engineering, or a related field is beneficial but not required. Relevant experience and skills matter most.
• Skills: Strong organizational and communication skills, with the ability to manage multiple tasks and prioritize effectively.
• Technical Understanding: While experience with our technologies is a plus, a willingness to learn and adapt is the most important factor. Familiarity with tools like Kubernetes, CI/CD pipelines, and configuration management systems is beneficial, but not mandatory. Linux skills are a strong plus.
• Mindset: An inherent drive to improve and optimize systems, processes, and workflows while maintaining a pragmatic approach to finding effective solutions.
Benefits
• Working on exciting and challenging projects in a rapidly growing company with advanced digital processes within the engineering team.
• A young and highly motivated team of digital professionals that collaborates across disciplines and shapes the business communication of tomorrow.
• Flat hierarchies, a lot of freedom and responsibility in your work, and a secure job in a forward-thinking company.
• A remote-first working environment with flexible working hours to ensure an optimal work-life balance.
• Extensive training and development opportunities to enhance your professional and personal skills.
• Central location of our office in Cologne’s Südstadt, modern workspaces, and high-quality technical equipment. Water, coffee, and fresh fruit as much as you like.
• An open, collegial atmosphere and regular team events.

title: Senior Typescript Developer (f/m/d)
desc:
Why us?
We offer you…
…the possibility to work on unique, open-source projects like our developer tool sidebase or working with a DAO
.…the possibility to work fully or hybrid in the office in Cologne, right at Rudolfplatz. Either way, we meet up regularly for team events and from time to time we even travel together.…
PR review that is not just another process for us. We are serious about taking your code and you to the next level, while also learning all the new patterns and techniques that your code has to offer. No bullshit, see for yourself!
…freedom to choose your own Operating System and working in an agile setting
.…a dedicated Senior Dev Ops Engineer who supports all project teams with superb development pipelines and who just makes your life a lot better
.…good work atmosphere in an ambitious team, flat hierarchies, appreciative communication and room for feedback.
If you want to apply, don’t submit a standard motivation letter, but rather send us 4-5 sentences on why you would be happy to work with or links to open source contributions you've made (don’t worry if you’ve made none, it is not expected). Contributions can be comments, commits, PRs, issues, …
Tasks
Your mission
You should be up for...
…our tech stack: We use the newest technologies, so you don’t waste time dealing with legacy things: You will work with TypeScript, Vue 3, Nuxt 3. All our projects are Dockerized and most run in Kubernetes.
…taking on a leading role: Together with a Product Manager you will be leading projects, usually in teams of 2-4 people, while having other Technical leaders to collaborate and consult. Oftentimes You’ll participate from the early stage of a project conceptualization phase, plan the architecture and then go into implementation.
…joining the fellowship: You will be working alongside other experienced Software Engineers and Product Managers on different software engineering projects. You will also be having weekly sparring sessions with one of the founders (Nils) to discuss your personal and professional development.
…helping people to level up: mentoring less experienced developers within in our proven mentoring process that helps both mentor and mentee to continuously improve their professional skills.
...having an impact: You will be an important part of Sidestream. You can have a lot of impact on the future of our company, for example by introducing new technologies or suggesting new industries to work in.
Requirements
Your profile
You are right here with us if you…
…have advanced experience in Typescript or JavaScript and ideally Vue or React. You don’t mind working in Frontend or Backend part of the Fullstack TypeScript applications that we build.
…have at least a few years of professional experience. We don’t set clear ranges here, but you should be able to finish projects in a self-sustained way and feel ready to help lead less experienced developers with finding solutions to complex problems.
…enjoy writing code that is high quality, production-ready and always peer-reviewed.
…can identify with our pragmatic mindset. First: do the right things, Second: do the things right.
…don’t mind doing a real life coding challenge at some point in the application process: We don’t look for pure technical managers. We all enjoy rolling up our sleeves and write some code.
…have good English and German skills to communicate with the team.

title: Working Student: Tech Administration and Fullstack Development (f/m/d)
desc:
Join Seedbox: Where Innovation Meets Opportunity
Are you a curious mind eager to dive into the world of Artificial Intelligence and make a real impact? At **Seedbox**, we're not just another tech company—we're a dynamic team of innovators shaping the future of AI-driven solutions. Founded with a bold vision to unlock the potential of AI within the German "Mittelstand," we blend the rich heritage of corporate innovation with the forefront of AI technology.
We craft intuitive AI solutions that seamlessly integrate into our clients' business processes. Collaboration is in our DNA—from brainstorming groundbreaking ideas to developing cutting-edge applications, we believe transparency and shared knowledge lead to the best results. We're committed to pushing boundaries, exploring new frontiers, and delivering solutions that are not only innovative but also ethically responsible and sustainable.
Our mission is clear: ensure that AI serves humanity positively, contributing to a better tomorrow for everyone.
Aufgaben
We are looking for a highly motivated **Working Student** to join our team and work closely with our Tech Lead. This role offers you the opportunity to gain hands-on experience in a vibrant environment where you can learn, contribute, and grow. You will:

Manage Technical Accounts: Dive into the administration of various technical platforms essential to our operations, gaining practical experience in systems management.
Develop Full-Stack Applications and Prototypes: Get hands-on with both frontend and backend development, building applications from the ground up using the latest technologies.
Work with Scalable Systems: Learn about managing scalable applications and their infrastructure, including cloud services, deployment strategies, and AI inference systems. Develop expertise in optimizing the performance of AI models in production, ensuring low-latency and high-throughput inferencing to meet the dynamic demands of client applications as they scale.
Experiment with New Technologies: Test innovative approaches and develop proofs of concept that could shape the future of our products and services.
Support the Tech Lead: Assist in day-to-day tasks, from preparing technical documentation to organizing project resources, learning directly from seasoned professionals.
Troubleshoot and Debug: Hone your problem-solving skills by identifying and resolving technical issues in developing applications and systems.
Participate in Code Reviews: Engage with the team in code reviews, enhancing your coding skills and learning best practices.
Stay Ahead of the Curve: Keep up with the latest industry trends in technology and AI, bringing fresh ideas to the table and influencing our innovation roadmap.

Qualifikation
What We're Looking For
- Passionate Student: You are currently enrolled in a Bachelor's or Master's program in Computer Science, Software Engineering, or a related field.
- Coding Enthusiast: You have a basic understanding of programming languages like Python or JavaScript and are excited to learn more.
- Aspiring Full-Stack Developer: You have an interest in both frontend and backend development and are familiar with frameworks like React, Angular, or Node.js.
- Problem Solver: You possess strong analytical thinking skills and enjoy tackling challenges.
- Eager Learner You're open-minded, enthusiastic, and hungry to acquire new skills and knowledge.
- Team Player: You thrive in collaborative environments and are ready to contribute to a team effort.
- Flexible and Adaptable: You can adjust to changing project requirements and are excited by the dynamic nature of tech development.
Benefits
What We Offer
- Learning and Growth: Immerse yourself in modern development practices and the implementation of cutting-edge AI applications. You'll gain invaluable insights and hands-on experience that will accelerate your career.
- Flat Hierarchies: Your ideas matter here. We encourage personal initiative and give you the space to innovate.
- State-of-the-Art Technology: Work with the latest Apple devices and software tools that make your job efficient and enjoyable.
- Prime Location: Our attractive office is located in the heart of Stuttgart, easily accessible by public transport and with ample parking.
- Vibrant Culture: Be part of a fun, energetic team. Enjoy regular team events and a workplace atmosphere that's both professional and light-hearted.
- Social Responsibility: Engage in meaningful sustainability and community initiatives. We believe in giving back and making a positive impact beyond our business.
- Recognition of Achievements: Work alongside highly motivated colleagues in an ambitious setting where your contributions are noticed and appreciated.
Why Seedbox?
Imagine being at the forefront of one of the most exciting and groundbreaking fields of our time—Artificial Intelligence. At Seedbox, you'll have the chance to actively shape the future. We're a company of doers and thinkers who are passionate about creating AI solutions that make a real difference.
Here, you'll have the freedom to explore, experiment, and push the boundaries of what's possible. We're committed to providing you with the resources, support, and inspiration you need to reach your full potential. From cutting-edge technology to a collaborative and encouraging work environment, you'll find everything you need to achieve greatness.
Ready to Make an Impact?
If you're excited about the prospect of contributing to transformative AI projects and eager to learn and grow in a dynamic environment, we'd love to hear from you. **Apply now** and join us on our mission to make a lasting impact on the world through Artificial Intelligence.

title: Growth Marketing Lead - Netherlands (All Genders)
desc:
🌟 WE ARE LOOKING FOR YOU 🌟
Are you passionate about driving growth and scaling businesses into new international markets? As our Expansion Lead, you will take charge of executing high-impact growth marketing strategies, helping us establish our presence across Europe, starting with the Netherlands. 🇳🇱 With a hands-on approach, you’ll be the key growth operator in our market expansion while also managing cross-functional coordination to ensure smooth and successful launches.
🌐 OUR MISSION 🌐
At ahead, we're transforming indulgent snacks into great-tasting better-for-you treats. Using innovative food technology, we replace refined sugar and empty calories with nutrients your body actually needs. With ahead, you can enjoy delicious snacks that satisfy your cravings – without compromising your health. We’re now looking for a talented and enthusiastic Growth Marketing Lead to spearhead our expansion efforts and establish a strong footprint across Europe. Join us to make a real impact and be a part of our mission to disrupt the food industry!
Tasks
🎯 YOUR TASKS:

📈 Growth Strategy & Execution: You will lead the development and execution of growth marketing strategies, with a primary focus on influencer marketing & paid social. Your goal will be to drive our customer acquisition goals and ensure that country-specific growth targets are consistently met.
🇳🇱Market Research & Launch Planning: You’ll conduct comprehensive market research to evaluate potential opportunities in the Netherlands. Based on your insights, you'll develop go-to-market strategies, form local partnerships, and create tailored promotional activities for successful market entries.
📊 Performance Analysis & Optimization: Your role includes continuously analyzing key growth metrics, customer behavior, and market trends. You will refine and adjust marketing strategies to outperform competitors, ensuring performance targets are hit in each new country.
🤝 Cross-functional Coordination: You will coordinate with marketing, product, operations, and finance teams to ensure smooth market expansion. You’ll work closely with internal teams and external partners to align on regulatory, cultural, and operational aspects across each market.
🚀 Project Leadership & Milestone Tracking: You will be responsible for tracking key expansion milestones, providing regular updates to leadership, and adjusting strategies as necessary. Your ability to lead initiatives and adapt will drive successful market growth.
💡 Local Market Adaptation: You’ll ensure that each market strategy is adapted to fit the unique cultural, consumer, and regulatory needs of the country, building strong foundations for long-term success.
🔗 Partnership Development: Building and managing local partnerships, you will establish relationships with key influencers, media channels, and local organizations that will help accelerate brand penetration and market success.

Requirements
📈 WHAT YOU NEED TO SUCCEED:

📈 Proven Performance OR Influencer Marketing Expertise: 5+ years of hands-on experience in influencer marketing OR performance marketing, with a focus on Paid Social – ideally within the food or consumer goods sector.
🌍 Deep Understanding of the Dutch Market: Experience leading product or brand launches, with specific expertise in the Dutch market and broader EU region.
📊 Data-Driven & Analytical: Strong analytical skills to interpret data, track KPIs, and adjust strategies to optimize performance and outcomes.
🚀 Project Management Excellence: Skilled at coordinating cross-functional teams and managing tasks with precision, ensuring smooth, on-time execution.
💡 Entrepreneurial Spirit: A proactive self-starter with a passion for growing brands in new markets, driven by a solution-oriented, get-things-done attitude.
🗣️ Native Dutch Speaker: Fluent Dutch and English communication skills are essential; proficiency in German is a plus.

Benefits
🍫 WHY JOIN US?

🌍 Hypergrowth Mode: Be part of one of Europe’s fastest-growing food-tech startups during our post-Series A scale-up phase.
📈 Quick Learning Curve: Work in a high-growth, ambitious environment where you’ll learn from hands-on challenges and top-tier mentors.
🤗 Everyone Wants It, We Have It: The best team – young, dynamic, international, and ambitious. Plus, fun events and after-work activities! Sounds like you?
🤝 Networking Opportunities: Connect with industry leaders, top investors, and the vibrant startup scenes in Berlin & Hamburg.
⭐ Great Product: Our low-sugar snacks are simply delicious. Have you tried them yet?
🏡 Flexibility & Perks: Work from our Hamburg HQ or remotely (2 days/week). Plus, enjoy great benefits like a MacBook, snacks, and company merch. 
🌴 Unforgettable Team Offsites : We work hard, but we also know how to have fun! Join us for epic team offsites every year.

WANT TO JOIN US?
Cool! Let’s get started. Here’s what the application process looks like:
📝 Send us your resume and a few reasons why you want to be a part of ahead.

We will get back to you as soon as possible to schedule an interview.
After our initial meeting, you’ll work on a small case study to give you a sense of the tasks you’ll be handling.
During the case presentation, you’ll have the chance to meet our team and the founders, Johannes and Philip.
If both sides are happy, you can start as soon as possible!

👉 Just reach out to us for a chat.

title: Staff Data Scientist, Investment Modelling
desc:
<gh-intro><text>
We're looking for an experienced Staff Data Scientist to join our Investment Modelling team. The role focuses on building quantitative growth models and optimising investments across hundreds of cities worldwide!</text></gh-intro>
 
<gh-about-us><title>About us</title>
<text>
Bolt is one of the fastest-growing tech companies in Europe and Africa, with over 150 million customers in 50+ countries. We're a global team of more than 100 nationalities joined on a common mission – to make cities for people, not cars. And we need you to make it happen!
</text>
</gh-about-us>
<gh-role-detail>
<title>About the role</title>
<text>
As a Staff Data Scientist, you'll develop forecasting models to predict the short- and long-term impact of incentives on business growth. You'll also use optimization techniques to distribute incentives over different periods, cities, and channels to maximise business growth.
You'll be responsible for building products powered by Data Science models that internal teams can use for portfolio planning and budgeting. In addition, you'll work on decomposing and modelling business growth into interpretable and actionable components.
As a Staff level Data Scientist, you will coach less experienced team members by sharing good practices in problem-solving, modelling, software engineering and soft skills. 
</text></gh-role-detail>
 <gh-responsibilities>
<title>Main Tasks and Responsibilities:</title>
<bulletpoints>

<point>Utilising advanced forecasting methods to design, develop, and maintain model frameworks across multiple business verticals for short- and long-term horizons, ensuring high accuracy and low operational cost.</point>
<point>Rapidly deploying models to production with AWS and internal ML platforms and working with Python, Spark, Presto, Docker, SageMaker, Airflow tech stack.</point>
<point>Solving complex optimisation problems by simulating strategic solutions for incentives budget allocation while balancing local and global constraints to maximise ROI.</point>
<point>Effectively communicating model outcomes as insights to a diverse group of stakeholders.</point>
<point>Working in cross-functional teams with Data Analysts, Data Scientists, Product Managers and Software Engineers to gain a deep understanding of technical and business needs.</point>
<point>Regularly share knowledge with other Data Scientists across all seniority levels, promoting learning and innovation in a collaborative environment.</point>

</bulletpoints></gh-responsibilities>
<gh-requirements>
<title>About you:</title>
<bulletpoints>

<point>You have at least 5 years of experience in Data Science and Machine Learning, ideally in product development within a technology-focused company.</point>
<point>You are experienced in Timeseries Forecasting, specifically financial metrics in marketplaces, scenario-based forecasting, capital allocation and budget modelling.</point>
<point>You apply first-principle thinking to break down complex challenges and design innovative solutions from fundamental concepts.</point>
<point>You're skilled in Python programming, libraries such as Pandas, Numpy, scikit-learn, and OR-tools for data analysis and modelling, with practical experience in statistical hypothesis testing that allows you to independently identify problems, explore trends, and discover opportunities through data-driven methods.</point>
<point>You exhibit excellent teamwork and strong communication skills in English, both verbal and written, enabling clear collaboration and knowledge-sharing.</point>
<point>You'll get bonus points if you have a PhD in a quantitative discipline such as Physics, Mathematics, Computer Science, or Economics, showcasing the ability to translate data insights into impactful products and demonstrating deep analytical and research capabilities.</point>

</bulletpoints>
<text>
Experience is great, but what we really look for is drive, intelligence, and integrity. So even if you don't tick every box, please consider applying if you feel you're the kind of person described above!</text></gh-requirements>

<gh-perks><title>Why you'll love it here:</title><bulletpoints>

<point>Play a direct role in shaping the future of mobility.</point>
<point>Impact millions of customers and partners in 600+ cities across 50+ countries.</point>
<point>Work in fast-moving autonomous teams with some of the smartest people in the world.</point>
<point>Accelerate your professional growth with unique career opportunities.</point>
<point>Get a rewarding salary and stock option package that lets you focus on doing your best work.</point>
<point>Enjoy the flexibility of working in a hybrid mode with a minimum of 2 days in the office each week to foster strong connections and teamwork.</point>
<point>Take care of your physical and mental health with our wellness perks.</point>

title: Account Manager (m/f/x) - German Speaker
desc:
Atolls is the world's largest community-driven shopping platform, active in over 20 markets worldwide.
After rebranding from Global Savings Group to Atolls, we've grown from a coupon provider into a global powerhouse, empowering consumers at every step of their shopping journeys. As a trusted destination, we help millions make smarter, more rewarding spending decisions through savings, cashback, deals, product inspiration, and reviews. Our mission is to support consumers from Anywhere to Purchase (A to P), making shopping simpler, smarter, and more enjoyable.
Our team of over 1,000 colleagues, representing 70 nationalities across 10 countries, works together to build digital products that transform the shopping experience. We foster a culture of innovation, learning, and collaboration, giving you the opportunity to grow, lead, and make meaningful contributions. Whether you're shaping products or improving user experiences, you'll be empowered to leave your mark and drive real impact.
Joining Atolls means becoming part of a global team that is constantly evolving and creating platforms relied on by millions of users for confident, seamless shopping experiences.

About this role :
We are currently looking for an Account Manager (m/f/x) to join our Account Management Team - Austria / Switzerland in our office in Berlin or Madrid. We operate the Cuponation, Kleine Zeitung and Blick couponing domains and manage the community of Preisjäger, a growing online shopping platform in Austria. The Account Management Team focuses on the commercial side of the business, negotiating higher commissions, exclusive voucher codes, and market leading deals with global players like H&M, Adidas, ASOS and TUI, as well as local SME brands. 
Responsibilities:

Manage and build relationships within a portfolio of top and medium sized brands
Develop the Preisjäger community into a top-tier affiliate in the Austrian market
Drive results amongst partners by consulting their needs of the couponing / deals channel
Secure market leading codes and deals
Sell exposure opportunities and promotional packages
Work creatively with our partners to fulfill their immediate and wider business goals
Prepare campaign reports and analysis for effective long-term growth
Collaborate with other departments as well as with colleagues from other countries
Participate in wider project work as and when required
Build and present performances reviews
Work strategically with the editorial teams to promote brand partners 
Represent the company at industry events 

Your Profile

3 years relevant work experience, preferably in (affiliate) marketing / sales / account management / partnership management
Excellent writing and communication skills
Dedication, self-motivation, and able to work both independently and in a team
Analytical skills- you learn fast and feel comfortable with using varied business intelligence tools
Good partner relationship management and negotiation skills
Intercultural awareness and the ability to work in a dynamic matrix organization
Excellent German language skills and fluency in written and spoken English
Last, but not least: you hate overpaying, are a discount-driven consumer. You know that online shopping can be both smart and fun.

 
Our Benefits:

A culture that cherishes your individual and professional development
An open-minded team that embraces new ideas, perspectives, and methodologies
Flexible hybrid working scheme with the possibility of working from abroad for up to 6 weeks
Cloud-based company
32 days of paid vacation + your birthday off
Global and Local get-togethers
Possibility of taking a sabbatical after 2 years in the company
Access to training and self-development learning platforms with up to 2.5 hours a week of your working hours

Are you up for it?
We're looking forward to receiving your CV in English.


At Atolls, we want to ensure that all employees can thrive in an inclusive environment. Our employment opportunities are open to every gender, race, religion, age, sexual orientation, ability, place of origin, or socioeconomic status. We remain committed to a culture of diversity, equity and belonging, where all employees are welcomed, respected, connected, and engaged.
